topPRs.title: feat(core): enhance multi-step workflow with retry logic and parameter extraction
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Enhances multi-step workflows with retry logic and parameter extraction capabilities.

### Changes

- **Retry logic for XML parsing**: Multi-step workflows now retry parsing up to 5 times (configurable via `MULTISTEP_PARSE_RETRIES`) with exponential backoff (1s, 2s, 4s... capped at 8s)
- **Summary generation retry with fallback**: Summary parsing retries with a graceful fallback message if all attempts fail (configurable via `MULTISTEP_SUMMARY_PARSE_RETRIES`)
- **Parameter extraction**: The multi-step decision template now supports a `<parameters>` key allowing actions to receive structured parameters from the LLM
- **Actions provider with parameter schemas**: Added `formatActionsWithParams()` function and `actionsWithParams` provider value for better LLM tool calling
- **Bounds checking**: Retry counts validated to be within 1-10 range

### Configuration

| Setting | Default | Description |
|---------|---------|-------------|
| `MULTISTEP_PARSE_RETRIES` | 5 | Number of retries for XML parsing failures |
| `MULTISTEP_SUMMARY_PARSE_RETRIES` | 5 | Number of retries for summary generation failures |

### Files Changed

- `packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts` - Retry logic and parameter extraction
- `packages/core/src/prompts.ts` - Updated multi-step template with parameters key
- `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/actions.ts` - Added formatActionsWithParams
- `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/__tests__/multi-step.test.ts` - Added tests

### Test Plan

- [x] Added tests for retry logic (success after retries, failure after max retries)
- [x] Added tests for summary fallback response
- [x] Added tests for parameter extraction (object, JSON string, invalid JSON handling)
- [x] All 19 multi-step tests pass
- [x] Core package builds successfully
- [x] Plugin-bootstrap package builds successfully

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Improves robustness and tool-calling for multi-step workflows.
> 
> - Updates `multiStepDecisionTemplate` to include explicit `parameters` and clarifies output keys
> - In `default-message-service.ts`:
>   - Adds bounded (1–10) retry with exponential backoff for decision-step XML parsing (`MULTISTEP_PARSE_RETRIES`) and summary generation (`MULTISTEP_SUMMARY_PARSE_RETRIES`)
>   - Parses `parameters` (object or JSON string), stores in `state.data.actionParams` and action-specific namespace; logs validation issues
>   - Provides fallback user response when summary parsing fails; improves structured logging
>   - Minor cleanup to always-respond channel/source overrides and response message construction
> - In `providers/actions.ts`, adds `formatActionsWithParams()` and exposes `actionsWithParams` so prompts include action parameter schemas
> - Extends tests to cover retry success/failure paths, summary fallback, and parameter extraction (object, JSON string, invalid JSON)
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit cd4e6f34ab9c8c2e619806cf5ff0e585b30ecee5. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: feat: improve message service handlers to perform async operations and optimizing with cloud platform
topPRs.author: prajwal-pl
topPRs.body:
This pull request introduces several improvements and refactorings to the `AgentRuntime` class and related message processing logic, focusing on optimizing entity/room/participant management, improving code style consistency, and adding a circuit breaker for LLM response generation. Additionally, it updates the Docker build context to include new configuration files.

**Entity, Room, and Participant Management Optimizations:**

- Parallelizes entity and world creation by using `Promise.all`, reducing redundant database calls and improving efficiency in `AgentRuntime.ensureEntityAndRoom` (`packages/core/src/runtime.ts`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1505-R1522) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1538-R1557)
- Refactors participant addition logic by introducing `ensureParticipantInRoomOptimized`, which leverages cached entities and parallelizes participant checks for both user and agent, minimizing database lookups (`packages/core/src/runtime.ts`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1564-R1571) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1574-L1578)
- Removes redundant entity existence checks and streamlines participant addition logic (`packages/core/src/runtime.ts`).

**Code Style and Consistency Improvements:**

- Updates many conditional statements to use curly braces, improving code readability and consistency throughout `AgentRuntime` and `DefaultMessageService` (`packages/core/src/runtime.ts`, `packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L525-R525) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L694-R695) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1132-R1132) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1669-R1679) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L2155-R2173) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L2305-R2327) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L2634-R2644) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L2840-R2850) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L2908-R2918) [[10]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L2924-R2934) [[11]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L2936-R2946) [[12]](diffhunk://#diff-f280a10771d9a8cf0e4e14619ac70538c52320af0ac8fb075a7eaad1c9fda84eL154-R164) [[13]](diffhunk://#diff-f280a10771d9a8cf0e4e14619ac70538c52320af0ac8fb075a7eaad1c9fda84eL209-R219) [[14]](diffhunk://#diff-f280a10771d9a8cf0e4e14619ac70538c52320af0ac8fb075a7eaad1c9fda84eL248-R258)

**Message Processing Enhancements:**

- Adds a circuit breaker to LLM response generation to handle repeated failures gracefully, increasing system robustness (`packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f280a10771d9a8cf0e4e14619ac70538c52320af0ac8fb075a7eaad1c9fda84eR36) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f280a10771d9a8cf0e4e14619ac70538c52320af0ac8fb075a7eaad1c9fda84eR99-R107)
- Changes attachment processing to be asynchronous and non-blocking, improving message processing pipeline efficiency (`packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts`).

**Docker Build Updates:**

- Updates the Docker build context to include `build-utils.ts` and `bunfig.toml`, ensuring these files are available in the final image (`Dockerfile`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-dd2c0eb6ea5cfc6c4bd4eac30934e2d5746747af48fef6da689e85b752f39557L22-R22) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-dd2c0eb6ea5cfc6c4bd4eac30934e2d5746747af48fef6da689e85b752f39557R58-R60)

**Minor Refactors:**

- Simplifies object property assignments using shorthand syntax in several places (`packages/core/src/runtime.ts`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L995-R995) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1020-R1028) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1187-R1190) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1505-R1522) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-731eeb09ecd79fd1c3157ce640aa046c8c798d2fdf133837b696e4e1bfa8c0c4L1538-R1557)

Let me know if you'd like to discuss any of these changes in more detail!

topPRs.title: fix(server): standardize message server route naming
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## fix(server): standardize message server route naming

### Problem

The `api-client` package was calling `/message-servers/*` routes that didn't exist on the server. The server had inconsistent naming with `/servers/*` routes instead.

```
Client calls:  POST /message-servers
Server had:    POST /servers          → 404!
```

### Solution

- Renamed `/servers/*` → `/message-servers/*`
- Renamed `:serverId` → `:messageServerId`
- Added deprecated routes with forwarding for backward compatibility

### Routes Changed

| Old Route | New Route |
|-----------|-----------|
| `POST /servers` | `POST /message-servers` |
| `GET /servers/:serverId/agents` | `GET /message-servers/:messageServerId/agents` |
| `POST /servers/:serverId/agents` | `POST /message-servers/:messageServerId/agents` |
| `DELETE /servers/:serverId/agents/:agentId` | `DELETE /message-servers/:messageServerId/agents/:agentId` |

### Backward Compatibility

Old routes still work but log deprecation warnings:
```
[DEPRECATED] POST /servers is deprecated. Use POST /message-servers instead.
```

### Tests

- Added 17 unit tests for route naming conventions
- All 420 server unit tests pass

completedItems.title: fix(core): add generic type support for custom event handlers
completedItems.body:
## Summary
- Add generic type parameter to `registerEvent` for custom events
- Allows plugins to define typed event payloads that extend `EventPayload`
- Includes unit test

## Example usage
```typescript
interface MyCustomPayload extends E
